newsitem.title: CAYMAN ISLANDS: Cayman Water sets $0.06 shr final dividend.
newsitem.headline: Cayman Water sets $0.06 shr final dividend.

text.p: Cayman Water Co said its board declared a final dividend on Class A shares for the year 1996 of $0.06 per share, payable to holders of record on March 31, 1997.
The payment was unchanged from the prior interim dividend of $0.06 per share and up 20 per cent from the $0.05 per share paid at this time last year.
The company also said it had first quarter 1997 revenues of US$1.968 million, up 10.6 per cent from the $1.78 million in the first quarter of 1996.
The company further said it was still fighting a hostile takeover bid from Argyle Partners of San Antonio, Texas.
Argyle has requested permission from the Cayman Islands government to purchase 50 pct of the stock of Cayman Water in addition to filing documents with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
Argyle Partners, through parent company Argyle Investment Corp, is owned by Bruce Bugg of San Antonio.
Cayman Water produces desalinated fresh water for public consumption in the Cayman Islands.
